Package datastructures

Class LinkedListNode<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • datastructures.LinkedListNode<E>
  • Type Parameters:
    E - type of element stored in the node
    public class LinkedListNode<E>
extends java.lang.Object
    Node for linked lists.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      protected E elt  
      protected LinkedListNode<E> next  

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      LinkedListNode()
      Constructs a node with no element null next pointer.
      LinkedListNode​(E[] elts, int n)
      Constructs a node with the nth element of the passed array.
      LinkedListNode​(E elt, LinkedListNode<E> next)
      Constructs a node with the specified element and next node.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean add​(int n, E elt)
      Adds a new node with the passed element as the nth node following this one.
      void add​(E elt)
      Appends a node with the passed element to the last node following this one.
      E get​(int n)
      Returns the element of the nth node following this one.
      E getElt()
      Returns the element housed in the node.
      E getLast()
      Returns the element of the last node following this one.
      LinkedListNode<E> getLastNode()
      Returns the last node following this one.
      LinkedListNode<E> getNext()
      Returns the next node pointed to by this node.
      boolean hasNext()
      Returns true if the node points to a next element.
      int indexOf​(java.lang.Object elt, int n)
      Returns the index of the first object of the node series starting from this one identical to the passed object + n.
      E next()
      Returns the element in the next.
      E remove​(int n)
      Removes the nth element of the series of nodes starting from this one.
      boolean set​(int n, E elt)
      If n is 0, set the element of current node to elt.
      boolean setAsEnd​(int n, E elt)
      If n is 0, set the element of current node to elt and delete all subsequent nodes.
      void setElt​(E elt)
      Sets node element to passed element.
      void setNext​(LinkedListNode<E> next)
      Sets next node to passed node.
      int size()
      Returns the amount of nodes following this one.

      • LinkedListNode

        public LinkedListNode​(E elt,
                      LinkedListNode<E> next)
        Constructs a node with the specified element and next node.
        Parameters:
        elt - element of node
        next - next node

      • LinkedListNode

        public LinkedListNode​(E[] elts,
                      int n)
        Constructs a node with the nth element of the passed array. Next node is new node with (n+1)th element of the passed array, and so on.
        Parameters:
        elts - array of elements to construct a series of nodes from
        n - array index

        Sets next node to passed node.
        Parameters:

        public E next()
        Returns the element in the next.

      • hasNext

        public boolean hasNext()
        Returns true if the node points to a next element. Otherwise, false.
        Returns:

        Returns the amount of nodes following this one.

      • add

        public void add​(E elt)
        Appends a node with the passed element to the last node following this one.
        Parameters:
        elt - element to append

      • add

        public boolean add​(int n,
                   E elt)
        Adds a new node with the passed element as the nth node following this one.
        Parameters:
        n - node index
        elt - element to add
        Returns:
        true if element could be added at the specified index. Otherwise, false.

      • get

        public E get​(int n)
        Returns the element of the nth node following this one.
        Parameters:
        n - node index
        Returns:
        null of there's no element at index n. Otherwise, element at index n

      • getLastNode

        public LinkedListNode<E> getLastNode()
        Returns the last node following this one.
        Returns:
        last node following this one

      • getLast

        public E getLast()
        Returns the element of the last node following this one.
        Returns:
        element of the last node following this one

      • remove

        public E remove​(int n)
        Removes the nth element of the series of nodes starting from this one.
        Parameters:
        n - node index
        Returns:
        null if the index was out of bounds. Otherwise, the removed element

      • indexOf

        public int indexOf​(java.lang.Object elt,
                   int n)
        Returns the index of the first object of the node series starting from this one identical to the passed object + n.
        Parameters:
        elt - object to search for
        n - number to add to return values
        Returns:
        -1 if object wasn't found. Otherwise, index of the first object identical to the passed object + n

      • set

        public boolean set​(int n,
                   E elt)
        If n is 0, set the element of current node to elt. Otherwise, set element of the nth node following this one to elt.
        Parameters:
        n - node index
        elt - element to set as new node element
        Returns:
        false if there isn't an nth node following this one. Otherwise, true.

      • setAsEnd

        public boolean setAsEnd​(int n,
                        E elt)
        If n is 0, set the element of current node to elt and delete all subsequent nodes. Otherwise, set element of the nth node following this one to elt and delete all subsequent nodes.
        Parameters:
        n - node index
        elt - element to set as new node element
        Returns:
        false if there isn't an nth node following this one. Otherwise, true.
